profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-10-15 23:00:05 -0400.

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection contains materials related to World War II rationing and price controls on the U.S. homefront.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to World War II rationing and price controls on the U.S. homefront. There is a gas ration card, application for a basic mileage ration book, and handouts from the Office of Price Administration.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is organized alphabetically. There are no series.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The exact donation of this collection is unknown, but these items were all donated to the University Libraries by Harriet Dyer Adams.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this colleciton is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The Department of Special Collections and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Harriet Dyer Adams Papers, 1942. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Adams Papers).

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Harrite Dyer Adams (1910-2005) was a librarian at the University at Albany and served as head of Special Collections in the 1970s. Adams was a 1927 graduate of the Milne School and in 1960 received her MLS degree from our University. Previously, she was a museum curator and worked in several art museums, including serving as the second female curator of the Cranbrook Art Museum from 1944-1948. These items are from her earlier tenure as curator, later acting director and curator, of the Person Hall Art Gallery at the University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill.

did.unittitle: Flyer on Rubber/Tire and Mileage Situation During War
Tire Record and Application for Basic Mileage Ration
What You Should Know About Wartime Price Control
